metadata.Title: CVE-2023-5869 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Buffer overrun from integer overflow in array modification

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5869` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 12.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libecpg6 - 12.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 12.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libpq5 - 12.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-12 - 12.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-client-12 - 12.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-plperl-12 - 12.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-12 - 12.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-12 - 12.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-12 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '12.17-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
